title: Create the Gapminder dataset
text:
# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

# Print the first 3 rows of the DataFrame
print(gapminder_df.head(3))

       country continent  year  life_expectancy  population_millions  \
0  Afghanistan      Asia  1952           28.801             8.425333   
1  Afghanistan      Asia  1957           30.332             9.240934   
2  Afghanistan      Asia  1962           31.997            10.267083

title: Gapminder Website
text: Gapminder is a dataset describing life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population for 142 countries from 1952 to 2007.

title: Gapminder Website
text:

Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
Life Expectancy and Population
Country Analysis

title: Country Analysis
text:
This page examines changes in life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population for a specific country over time.

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

country_name = "China"
c = df[df["country"] == country_name].sort_values("year")

plt.figure()
plt.plot(c["year"], c["life_expectancy"])
plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy")
plt.title(f"Life Expectancy Over Time ({country_name})")
plt.show()

plt.figure()
plt.plot(c["year"], c["gdp_per_capita"])
plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("GDP per Capita")
plt.title(f"GDP per Capita Over Time ({country_name})")
plt.show()

plt.figure()
plt.plot(c["year"], c["population_millions"])
plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("Population (millions)")
plt.title(f"Population Over Time ({country_name})")
plt.show()






















Analysis: For this country, life expectancy increases over time. GDP per capita rises substantially, while population also grows, showing simultaneous economic and demographic change.

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text:
This page explores how life expectancy and GDP per capita change over time in the Gapminder dataset.

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

# Average trends over time (all countries)
g = df.groupby("year")[["life_expectancy", "gdp_per_capita"]].mean().reset_index()

plt.figure()
plt.plot(g["year"], g["life_expectancy"])
plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy")
plt.title("Average Life Expectancy Over Time")
plt.show()

plt.figure()
plt.plot(g["year"], g["gdp_per_capita"])
plt.xlabel("Year")
plt.ylabel("GDP per Capita")
plt.title("Average GDP per Capita Over Time")
plt.show()















Analysis: Over time, average life expectancy increases and average GDP per capita also increases, suggesting that improvements in economic conditions are associated with longer lifespans.

title: Life Expectancy and Population
text:
This page analyses the relationship between life expectancy and population using the Gapminder dataset.

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

plt.figure()
plt.scatter(df["population_millions"], df["life_expectancy"])
plt.xlabel("Population (millions)")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy")
plt.title("Life Expectancy vs Population")

plt.show()








Analysis: There is no simple linear relationship between population size and life expectancy. Many small and large countries can have both low and high life expectancy.
